intro: Gnidia thesioides var. thesioides, commonly known as the Natal ironwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and hard, heavy wood. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by distinctive, winged fruits. It is often found in coastal forests and is valued for its durable timber and ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a threatened species in some regions.
